numbered_ace_sentences: 1. Young men contact their parents less often than women contact their parents.
2. The lowest percentage of contact is in-person visits.
3. This indicates that parents are less involved in the lives of their children.
4. The study excludes people who do not keep contact with their parents.
5. I wonder how much culture influences the number of parents who are involved in the lives of their children.
6. In many cultures, it is a tradition that several generations live in one home.
7. I want to know how many families live with several generations in one home.
8. I wonder why females text their parents more often than males text their parents.
9. Texting shows the biggest gap between females and males in the graph.
10. Many people in my community keep frequent contact with their parents when they enter adulthood.
11. The results of the study are shocking compared to the culture in my city.
12. The headline is: Stay In Touch: Young Adults Keep Digital Contact.
